http://example.org/ImplementationGuide/medby

resource.name: KNH National Cancer Centre
resource.description: Kenyatta National Hospital's Oncology Centre, providing national-level cancer diagnosis and specialized care.

resource.name: Nyandarua County Cancer Treatment Centre
resource.description: A representative oncology center supporting diagnosis, treatment and follow-up for Nyandarua County, aligned with the National Cancer Registry.

resource.name: Oncologist Role at KNH
resource.description: Dr. Grace Wanjiku’s role as Consultant Oncologist at Kenyatta National Hospital

resource.name: Oncology Care Plan Kenya
resource.description: A structured CarePlan profile for oncology management in Kenya. Aligns with the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI and County Cancer Registries. Supports multidisciplinary cancer care coordination, treatment protocols, and reporting using ICD-10 exclusively.

resource.name: Oncology Diagnostic Report - Biopsy for Cervical Cancer
resource.description: Pathology report for cervical biopsy indicating squamous cell carcinoma

resource.name: Oncology Diagnostic Report Kenya
resource.description:
FHIR R4-based profile for diagnostic reports in oncology within the Kenyan healthcare context.
Supports pathology, radiology, laboratory, and imaging reports aligned with:
- Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027)
- Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030)
- KEMRI cancer registries
- UHC and SHA reporting
- National staging and reporting standards
- County-based registry efforts (e.g., Nyandarua)

resource.name: Oncology Encounter Kenya
resource.description:
A profile for documenting oncology-related patient encounters in Kenya, aligned with the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI registry data needs, and county-level cancer reporting workflows.
Supports tracking of staging visits, diagnosis, treatment initiation, follow-ups, referrals, and palliative care within the Kenyan oncology ecosystem.

resource.name: Oncology Implementation Guide for Kenya (Oncology-IG-Kenya)
resource.description:
This Implementation Guide demonstrates how HL7® FHIR® can be leveraged to enhance oncology care in Kenya. It includes standardized profiles such as OncologyKenyaPatient and OncologyObservationKenya, tailored search parameters, and extensions reflecting Kenya's SHA and health system realities.

It is developed independently by a Kenyan health tech enthusiast to stimulate innovation, interoperability, and alignment with national cancer priorities.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Claim
resource.description:
A FHIR R4-based Claim profile tailored for cancer-related health financing in Kenya.
Supports SHA (Social Health Authority) reimbursement workflows and aligns with:
- Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy 2023–2027,
- Kenya Cancer Policy 2020–2030,
- KEMRI cancer reporting and financing infrastructure.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Condition
resource.description: A Condition profile for structured oncology diagnosis documentation in Kenya, aligned with national cancer registry reporting and HL7® FHIR® standards.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Coverage
resource.description: Defines insurance and reimbursement details under SHA in Kenya, ensuring financial tracking and integration with NCCP Data Systems.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Diagnostic Report
resource.description: Defines pathology and laboratory reports for oncology patients in Kenya, integrating with DHIS2 and cancer registries.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya FHIR Server Capability Statement
resource.description: Defines the capabilities of the Oncology Implementation Guide for Kenya conforming to national cancer care standards.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Location
resource.description:
FHIR Location profile tailored for cancer care delivery points in Kenya.
Supports capture of facilities relevant to cancer diagnosis, treatment, and palliative care,
aligned with national cancer control strategies and KEMRI cancer registry reporting.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Patient
resource.description: Customized patient profile for oncology care in Kenya. This profile is part of the Oncology Implementation Guide for Kenya (Oncology-IG-Kenya) — a draft version (0.1.0) dated 2025-06-18. It models key patient elements aligned with Kenya’s national cancer registry, SHA (Smart Health Authority), DHIS2, and local care workflows. This guide demonstrates how HL7® FHIR® can be applied to transform cancer care, from screening to palliative support. It is a proof-of-concept created independently by a Kenyan digital health enthusiast, with no official endorsement, to inspire innovation using open health standards and locally relevant data modeling.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Registry Report
resource.description: Defines structured cancer registry reporting format for Kenya, integrating with KEMRI Cancer Registry, Nairobi Cancer Registry, and DHIS2.

resource.name: Oncology Kenya Supply Request
resource.description:
A FHIR R4-based SupplyRequest profile for cancer-specific medical supplies in Kenya.
Supports drug procurement, diagnostic supply needs, and inventory tracking aligned with
Kenya’s National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), 
and practical needs of facilities reporting to the KEMRI registry and SHA ecosystem.

resource.name: Oncology Medication Request Kenya
resource.description: A profile for prescribing cancer-related medications in Kenya. Aligned with the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), and reporting needs of KEMRI and county cancer registries. Supports chemotherapy, palliative care, and anti-cancer drugs with ICD-10 and Kenya EMR terminology support.

resource.name: Oncology Observation Kenya
resource.description: Observation profile for cancer-related data elements in Kenya's oncology care, supporting reporting, staging, diagnosis, and national registry alignment.

resource.name: Oncology Practitioner Kenya
resource.description:
FHIR R4 profile for practitioners involved in oncology care in Kenya.
Aligns with Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030),
KEMRI Cancer Registry guidelines, and workforce tracking as emphasized in the KESHO and Nyandarua registry reports.
Supports credentialing, role classification, and regional deployment for cancer care delivery.

resource.name: Oncology Practitioner Role Kenya
resource.description:
FHIR R4 profile for defining roles of healthcare professionals involved in oncology services in Kenya.
Supports assignment of oncology roles, facility affiliations, cancer services scope, and geographic deployment.
Based on Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027),
KEMRI cancer registry requirements, and KESHO conference findings.

resource.name: Oncology Procedure Kenya
resource.description: Procedure profile tailored for oncology use in Kenya, supporting documentation of diagnostic, surgical, medical, radiotherapy, and palliative interventions. Aligned with Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI registry practices, and county-level reporting, using ICD-10 as the sole terminology for reporting procedures and conditions.

resource.name: Oncology Questionnaire Response Kenya
resource.description: Structured response to oncology-related questionnaires used in Kenyan cancer screening, diagnosis, treatment, palliative care, and national registry reporting workflows. Aligns with Kenya's National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI data elements, and county registry efforts.

resource.name: Oncology Service Request Kenya
resource.description:
A specialized ServiceRequest profile for oncology-related referrals, diagnostics, and procedures in Kenya. Informed by the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), and data practices from KEMRI and county cancer registries.
Supports service ordering for biopsies, imaging, oncology specialist reviews, palliative care referrals, and tracking within a multidisciplinary care model.

resource.name: Patient Education Level
resource.description: Captures the highest level of formal education attained by a patient in Kenya. Supports cancer registry reporting, care planning, and socioeconomic assessment.

resource.name: Patient Occupation
resource.description: The current or most recent occupation of the patient.

resource.name: Referral for Breast Ultrasound - Kiambu County
resource.description: Service request for breast ultrasound to evaluate palpable lump in patient

resource.name: Referral Source for Oncology Care Plan

resource.description: Flag to indicate observation should be reported to the cancer registry.

resource.description: Allows filtering patients by Education Level extension

resource.name: Search by Facility UPI
resource.description: Allows filtering patients by Facility UPI

resource.name: Search by Gender
resource.description: Filter patients by biological sex

resource.name: Search by National ID
resource.description: Filter patients by Kenyan National ID

resource.name: Search by Occupation
resource.description: Allows filtering patients by Occupation extension

resource.name: Search by SHA ID
resource.description: Allows filtering patients by SHA ID

resource.description: Filter patients by sub-county (address.district)

resource.name: Send Report to National Cancer Registry
Surgical Biopsy at Moi Teaching and Referral Hospital
resource.description: Surgical biopsy performed for suspected breast cancer

resource.name: Top Common Cancers in Kenya - ICD-10
resource.description: ICD-10 codes for the most common cancers in Kenya as per national strategy.

resource.name: Tumor Marker ValueSet
resource.description: Tumor markers used in Kenyan oncology diagnostics.

resource.name: Tumor Markers
resource.description: Tumor markers commonly used in oncology diagnostics and monitoring in Kenya.

resource.name: Tumor Reduction Goal
resource.description: Reduce tumor size prior to surgery
